title: Intellectual Property
definition: Intangible property created by an individual or organisation
examples: Things you write, make or produce
purpose: Protects creators from others profiting from their hard work without consent.
Makes it easier to take legal action against anyone who steals/copies it, with an aim of making a profit.
The type of protection you can get depends on your creation
protectionDescription: When choosing to protect intellectual property, you have two main methods of doing so.
